title: Letters: HS2 is an expensive, unpopular vanity project – and must be stopped before it’s too late
text:
SIR– It is rumoured that the Government-commissioned review of HS2 is likely to suggest a major scaling back – or even cancellation.

It has been accepted that the cost will be more than £105 billion, based on 2015 estimates, despite continued denials by HS2 Ltd.

The number of trains, as well as their speed, will not be what the business case suggested. The average cost per metre of track will be in excess of £100,000 – and not one metre has even been laid yet. Meanwhile, the estimated cost to every British household will be over £5,000, though relatively few householders are likely to benefit.

HS2 is not, and never will be, popular with the public, who have consistently indicated that they would...
